moves.1... d6: Pirc defense, a now seldom used opening.
moves.2... f5: g6 is most popular, this is a very unusual move.
moves.3... Nf6: Putting pressure on the e4 pawn.
moves.5. Nge2: d5 is better, but this develops the knight, and it doesn't look like the knights going anywhere, so for now, it's all good for white.
moves.5... e5: This is the tarrasch defense on the wrong side, and with white in a very different position.
moves.6. dxe5: Wanting to get the knight out of position after dxe5 7. Qxd8+ Nxd8.
moves.7. Qxd8+: Now the knight or the king must be taken out of place.
moves.7... Nxd8: The knight volunteers and is now out of position.
moves.8. Bg5: Not a pin now, as the queen is gone.
moves.10. O-O-O: Castles queenside? Could be dangerous with the bishop where it is.
moves.11... gxf6: Black is in a nice position, with all of their pieces developed.
moves.12. g3: Wanting to develop the bishop queenside.
moves.12... Nc5: Wanting to castle queenside, and with nothing else to do the knight attempts to block the path of the rook on d1.
moves.13... Be6: Just in case the bishop is needed on a2.
moves.14... fxe5: Now the bishop can check the king: Bg5+
moves.17. Rhe1: The knight doesn't need extra protection, but it is received anyway.
moves.18... Rf2: Now the knight is pinned again. Heheheh…
moves.19. Bf1: Grrr. This knight is looking extremely important.
moves.19... Bg5: Threatening the rook who has no where to go but d1.
moves.21. Ka1: If the rook can move to b1, then the knight will be free.
moves.21... Rf2: Seeing what white was planning, black saw Rd8.
moves.22. Rdb1:
The knight is free!
White doesn't see it, but: Rd8 Ng1 Bd2 wins rook.
moves.23. Rbd1: Awww, what? He DID see it?
moves.24. Nb1: One might see a free rook on e1, but another might see that after Be1 white can play Rxd8+, but, to yet another, one might see: Bxe1 Rxd8+ Kg7, and now the bishop on f1 is stuck and doomed. The last one is correct.
moves.24... Bxe1: As the bishop takes the rook, the truth dawns on white, but he won't give up!
moves.25... Kg7: …Or, maybe he will. Anyway, white resigns here. Thank you for reading my annotated game!

players: D'know who (D'know) vs. D'know who else (D'know)
